No flat screen television in any of the three rooms I saw, and the bathrooms seemed tired. There was also no free internet service - not even in the lobby area. Parking is $30 per night - valet only. Whilst I have read complaints about this, it is fairly standard for an LA hotel whether in downtown, at the airport or in Beverly Hills. You can get a cheaper rate at an open car lot next to the Disney Concert Hall but without in/out privileges. I would stay here again if I got the hotel on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Average says it all.....”
Reviews.Author: JP2E
Reviews.Content: Average says it all. I’ve stayed at Marriott’s around the world and this one is definitely in the lower half. The only reason for the three stars is its price. I found it rather reasonable for a downtown hotel. The staff is extremely accommodating and nice and the pool is decent. Overall the hotel is very dated and old and needs a makeover. If you have to stay here ask for a higher floor facing the street, not the freeway. Our first night we faced the freeway and my wife could not sleep. The staff was very nice and switched us to a room facing the street. Although you could still hear the freeway it was a lot less. The $30 valet is a rip off and the food is not very good. Overall the hotel is good for the price. If you can swing it the JW Marriott down the street is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gushkub
Reviews.Content: The Downtown Los Angeles Marriott is one of the worst Marriott Hotels anywhere. The rooms are noisy even at the top floor, Aircondition did not work, Hotel is run down, and they use very cheaply decorated for the level of nightly rate they charge. I chose the hotel because I am a Marriott Rewards Member, I stay at Marriotts Worl Wide, and the location of this hotel was just what I needed. But I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, don't give your car to valet parking”
Reviews.Author: manger123
Reviews.Content: The stay was terrible. Valet parking stole some very expensive items, and hotel nor valet parking would fully investigate or reimburse for stolen items....Would not stay here. Watch out for your belongings!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a bit disappointed with this link of the chain.”
Reviews.Author: shauste
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Wilshire Grand for one night, I found this hotel to be outstanding in comparison. Very clean and comfortable rooms. Courteous staff and fast, easy check in and check out. I, however, find it odd that a hotel of this quality would charge for internet service. That should be a given at any hotel these days considering many people conduct business by the internet. The valet parking…well…its expensive. Seems like Marriott is taking advantage of the limited parking in downtown LA by being partnered with a parking company. Very expensive at $30 per day and the valets had the nerve to hover around looking for a tip. There are no coin wash facilities on site. The restaurant is expensive and the selection is minimal. There is a Concierge Room on the 11th floor but if you want anything stronger than Coke, it will cost you. Overall, I was comfortable in this hotel and know what to expect. Convenient location to where I had to conduct business and I just may stay here again on my next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Forgettable”
Reviews.Author: TandemWorld
Reviews.Content: Not much to say - good or bad - about this hotel. It did fit the bill for a one night stay. Most noteworthy... QUALITY - Another example of what seems to be an emerging trend. The public spaces have been recently updated and are nice, which makes getting to your room a bit of a shock. While clean and well maintained, the room has not been updated in some time and maintains the signature look and feel of a 1980's Marriott. LOCATION - Great downtown location. We were able to walk to several restaurants and to LA Live, which was a bit of a trek, but still doable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Austinmike28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the BCS National Championship game. This is a pretty nice hotel with a good location, although for the price I think you can find better value out there. Check-in was a little bit of a hassel as they had inadvertantly let someone check-in already under our name. I'm not sure how that happens, cause I think it's pretty standard that you show ID, etc. Anyway, they got that mess cleared up and we were AOKAY. The rooms are pretty standard, with two queen beds in ours. The bathroom was HUGE, and had lights that made you feel like were in the movies!! They had a bunch of coffee and tea in the room that you could have free of charge. The worst thing about the room though was the TV, it was tiny and OLD. For the amount of money that they want for a room, they really need to update to some flat screen tv's. On our entire trip, this was the most expensive place and had the worst TV. Overall it's a nice hotel, probably would be great for a buisness traveler, but if we had to do it over again we would stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a leisure vacation stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricky347
Reviews.Content: This hotel was probably 3.5 stars 25 years ago. It has not been updated and the hotel was mostly empty while we were there. We wound up at this dump from Priceline, which claims it to be 3.5 stars. The small pool was not heated and cannot be used in the winter. The floral pattern on the floor screams 1981 cleanliness was an issue. Internet is not free. Parking is $30/night!! This is not disclosed when you get the room on priceline and added a full 60% to the cost for the room, which is unreasonable. My wife was working out in the fitness center and the leg of the elliptical machine came loose and she fell off. I called the front desk, which coldly told me, "someone will be there soon." We waited 20 minutes and no one came. This hotel is located in downtown LA, far from everything except LA Live/Staples Center. If you are coming to LA for anything other than 1-2 nights for business/sports, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “LA stopover”
Reviews.Author: data08
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay in LA for a couple of nights in between our trans-continental flight and very pleased with the price paid for a Marriott. Location was right across from the World Trade Center and would make a convenient convention hotel. Staff were helpful and hotel had nice spacious lobby. Pool was small but nice, though we did not have our swim suits with us. Ate at the hotel's restaurant and the food was fine. Room and hallway was clean, though appeared a bit dated. Have to positively commend the housekeeping staff for getting the rooms cleaned by 10am (without our request for them to do so... they are most timely and efficient when compared to other housekeeping services in my numerous stays at different hotels this year). Felt that the location was not as "in" to the downtown walking area compared to other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Average with Parking Con”
Reviews.Author: Calmity72
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a nice lobby with large rooms but of average quality. The biggest con, as all of the other posters mentioned, is parking is $30 per day and then you still need to tip the vallet staff! Save yourself some money and park directly across the road in the World Trade Centre, after 5pm, for $10. Internet is also $10 per day so when you add up these extras your cheap room doesnt work out that cheap. It was down season when we went but the immedaitely surrounding restaurants didnt provide a great deal of choice and it was quite far from most lesuire activities. This hotel would be ideal for business and/or Staple centre travellers. I wouldnt personally choose to use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “5* hotel with 5* priced extras and 3* quality”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Nemesis
Reviews.Content: Parking/Charges The main thing which really annoyed me about this hotel was that fact that I had to pay $30 per night to park the car when im staying at the hotel which I was not aware of when I made the booking and I would not have stayed here if I knew this. The Valet are a hassle looking for money every time you come and go. WIFI was $10 for 24 hours if I recall correctly. It always irritates me when a hotel wants a guest to pay for WIFI. I will actually stay at a hotel just because it has free WIFI and for the ones that charge I know I can walk down the street to a cafe which will provide it for free. The Room The bed was great, so soft and lots of pillows, just what myself and my partner needed after a long flight. The decor of the room was a bit dated and boring. Lighting I found this a bit strange. When I entered the room there was a switch on the wall which turned on a light bulb over the door/entry area which is fine. What was strange is that there were no lights in the ceiling over the main room area including the bed. Instead there were 4 or 5 lamps around the room which I had to turn on individually. Even just one bulb in the middle of the ceiling with a switch at the door would have so much more convenient. Food The food and drinks were over priced and there are plenty of nearby good quality restaurants serving great food at the right price. I did not have any food or drink from the hotel. Pool I think I would give the pool a good complement. It was a nice area to chill out, enjoy the weather and go for a swim. The pool is a bit small in comparison to other hotels I have stayed at and you know your in the middle of the city. Would I stay here again? Probably not. LA has such a great transport infrastructure that its easy to get in and out of downtown in minutes. A day pass on the metro is $3 which also allows you to use the bus if necessary. I still feel ill thinking about the $150 I paid in parking. I really did not feel like I had stayed at a 5* hotel when leaving this hotel. After this hotel I drove to the MGM Grand Las Vegas which is a 4* and was so much better than the Marriot Downtown LA. Just noticed something when I was filling out this review, it asks me if Pets were allowed. I would not have expected that they were but I remember a woman walking with a dog from the elevators through the lobby to the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale hotel, but you'll pay for parking and Internet”
Reviews.Author: smokedmeat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, December 2-4. Reserved one room with Priceline at the nightly rate of $61 USD. This was the hotel I was hoping to get, so I was happy when it showed up. My friend and I arrived in the evening for check in. There were plenty of staff at the front desk at all times, and everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. The bowl of salt water taffy and infused water in the lounge were nice touches as well. We got a double room (1219) with a view of the Harbor Freeway and downtown traffic. There were no issues with noise, however, and the room was quite spacious. One small drawback was that the television in the room was quite ancient. Also, there is no free Internet available in the hotel except with certain specific bookings. I needed to access the Internet to research the next stop on the trip, so I paid the $9.95 USD fee for 24 hours of wireless access. Also, I had been warned by other users about the valet parking, but the staff was courteous upon arrival and always had the car ready given a 15-minute call ahead of time to the front desk. The daily fee of $30 USD was quite expensive but in line with other parking garages I passed by in the downtown area. The main reason for choosing the hotel was its proximity to the Staples Center, about a 20-minute walk along South Figueroa Street. We attended a Clippers basketball game and a Kings hockey game there. The area can be a little shady at times, but I was never troubled on either night. I would stay again at the Marriott for the same price. Still, the area is not overly touristy so I would only stay there if attending an event at Staples Center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable clean spacious rooms in large conference-center style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: This large conference-center style Marriott in downtown L.A. is a fair bargain for the leisure traveller if you find a good price. While it is located in the downtown business district of Los Angeles, which has comparitively little interest to many other nooks and areas of the sprawling Los Angeles area, a certain amout of any tourist's time will be required in the car, driving around between these many areas of interest. And there are a few good options for dining, chic drinks and entertainment within walking distance of the hotel, as well. A big car port and valet service opens up into a soaring lobby, with wings of conference rooms in all directions. The rooms were big, spacious, comfortable, clean, modern. We had a view out onto 3 overlapping highways surrounded by palm trees, which is a very "Los Angeles" view, and I did not mind it at all, as the sound-proofed windows kept the noise out. (the highways are not TOO close to the hotel.) My top reccomendation: walk to the nearby Standard Hotel Downtown to their ultra-chic rooftop bar / adult playground. This outdoor venue, high amidst the glass skycrapers of downtown Los Angeles seen in every TV show and film depicting L.A., is complete with a bright green astroturf floor around a swimming pool, fireplace, bed-pods, well poured martinis and a uber fashionable crowd straight off the pages of Wallpaper magazine. A very "L.A." experience for the out of towner. I will certainly go back for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and pleasurable find.”
Reviews.Author: Suzelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel will be our small company's hotel of choice for the 2x a month times we are in Los Angeles; Sept 09 being our first time there. Their sales staff has been very welcoming, the accounting department very patient with working out the billing in a way that will suit us as well as them. Love the lobby space area. Pool area is apparently fairly newly refurbished though we did not have the opportunity of using it. Found all staff eager to extend themselves to assist us, including the waiter working the bar/restaurant in the lobby area, to accommodate me for a lunch in the mid afternoon. Rooms very comfortable, and in particular enjoyed the layout with its sitting corner area, where one day I rested for a number of hours, with the laptop on the little table next to it. Lots of pillows!

Reviews.Title: “accessible, large room, nice toiletries”
Reviews.Author: juststartedtraveling
Reviews.Content: booked through priceline for a great price on this hotel. was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. bath and body works toiletries were nice. metro rail and local bus lines are nearby as are sights (walt disney concert hall/music center, etc). parking is expensive. if i had to choose between the bonaventure and the marriott i would choose the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Public Transport”
Reviews.Author: E.Clements
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night stay at Downtown Marriott and were pleasantly surprised. We went to Disneyland by train. Hollywood and Universal Studios by Metro and 3rd St Promenade Santa Monica on the Big Blue Bus. Hotel is so convenient for public transport. I am a senior and travelled with my adult son and can honestly say walking was not a problem. Not a lot to do at night but after all the sightseeing it's not a major issue. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “not bad,but will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: achif
Reviews.Content: for my first time to stay in a mariott chain,i will probably not stay there again.very expensive for the value,staff not friendly at all,very small pool,miserable fitness room,unbelievable disgusting and poor breakfast.only the room was large enough(but at the price,you could have much,much better other place).overall,i think that all managers hotel in USA have so much to learn and practice from hotels in EUROPE and FAR EAST,in all fields.i was very disappointed in the USA standard of the hotels.i would like if some responsible of the tourism departement can read my review,so they can chek the standard of their hotels in USA,because i'm a big traveller,and i make many comparaisons,and believe me,hotels in USA have to do big efforts.i dont know if they became so bad because of the financial crisis,but they have to reamenage their staff,their service,their welcoming,their food,and their price(my god).

Reviews.Title: “Abominable!!!”
Reviews.Author: agster03
Reviews.Content: General Management has NO CLUE on how to run the place. The Pool was a sad attempt in class, the food took forever in middle of day when NO ONE was even ordering.. everything was broken, escalators, elevators, internet. JW MARRIOTT would cringe if he were alive and saw this palce.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice if You Can Afford the Luxuries...”
Reviews.Author: suva55
Reviews.Content: This stay was only possible because I got a bargain on Hotwire, $64 I think. Great hotel and room for the price. However, and this is a big however, if you are on business and rent a car, then the ONLY option for conveniently parking is the valet which is $30 a day, making it among the biggest hotel rip-offs in the country. But as another reviewer has reported, much cheaper parking is available if you hunt for it (hint-- the hotel staff will NOT help you find this parking, or even admit it exists...the concierge and desk help will tell you that the parking price is "competitive" and even "low for downtown LA"). I could not do such hunting because of my limited time away from my conference, and because there was almost always bumper to bumper street traffic, and because it was raining all weekend. Further, every time you drop off your car, or ask for it to be brought to the front of the hotel, you must tip the driver. $2 is the absolute bare minimum for this kind of service, and so if you need to come and go about five times during the day, this is another $20 daily added to the parking thing. And these valets are very serious. There is a whole army of them, and then there is a supervisor who actually manages the order in which the valets are assigned to cars, and interacts directly with the hotel guests, and expects his own tip. Internet service is $10 a day, no free router in the lobby either, so if you are even remotely interested in getting anything done, you must pay up. A martini at the bar, not name brand but a well drink, is $10 before tip, and don't even try to make it up by eating through several tumblers of bar snack mix, your stomach can't take it. So, bottom line, when do you find yourself stressing about all these add-ons? When you are sitting in your very comfortable and clean hotel room, with fluffy pillows and turndown service, watching a "free" premium channel while perusing the room service breakfast menu that you can't afford anyway. The NBA championship had just started at the Staples Center and so many guests were people with large disposable incomes, who seemed to command the greatest attention from staff. On the plus side, the view from my room was exquisite and made me feel right at the heart of downtown. So I would suggest this hotel only if you have the money to relax there and be taken care of, but if not, then beware of selecting any of Hotwire's unnamed four-star hotels in downtown LA for $60-65 because it's a trap--the hotel will get your money anyway...

Reviews.Title: “great location & price & save the $30 on parking~”
Reviews.Author: NyTraveler321
Reviews.Content: got 2 rooms at this hotel from priceline.com for $60/night. the room was great with comfy beds and pillows. bathroom was fill with bath & body works stuff. one of the rooms had a separate bath and shower. we were on the 5th floor so we didnt get much of a view except for the freeway. we rented a car for travel in LA and yes the valet parking at the hotel was $30 a night and it was operated outside of the hotel. but there's actually ALOT of parking garages around the neighborhood for much cheaper. alot of meter parking after 11PM around the block. couple of nights, there were free meter parking right outside the hotel. we parked at an parking lot on 8th st (4 blocks down) for $6 flat rate all night. we only used the hotel for sleeping so this didnt bother us.otherwise parking is very expensive in LA. $4 meters/hr! location of hotel was nice on the week days, during the weekend it was really deserted. also very conveniently located 2 blocks away from the major freeways. went to most of the attractions nearby in under 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Very safe and clean.”
Reviews.Author: blr5004
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went here during the Rose Bowl. We did not have a car so the location was very easy to walk to subway and the bus. Staff was very helpful and rooms were clean. The area seems very safe although on the weekends it is dead, not good if you want nightlife. The only thing we did not like were the pillows. There are good restaurants within walking distance. Overall, great hotel, I am so glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: myscreenie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location in downtown LA, with a great proximity to the shops at the Westin across the street and the World Trade Center parking lot (much cheaper than the valet service). I stayed on the concierge floor because it had cheaper weekend rates, however no one felt inclined to mention that this was because the business center was shut. The room itself was quite spacious with a comfortable bed with a generous collection of plush pillows and there was also a nice picture window instead of a fourth wall. There is wireless internet available for $10 a day, which seemed reasonable. The real deal-breaker for any future returns is the horrible customer service. The person checking me in was rude about my credit card and rather sassy as if he was looking forward to losing his job. Moreover, when I booked on the website, I received an email confirming me for the correct date, but when I phoned about this booking, it turns out that I had been incorrectly booked twice on the same day. When I called customer service, rather than sort this out the person insisted that this was my fault, even though I had the e-mail right in front of me. The person finally caved and said I could cancel the incorrect booking as a "one-time exception", well fine with me since I never plan to stay at another Marriott ever again. Bottom line, stay at the Westin Bonaventura. They have better rates, better service, better location, better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view around”
Reviews.Author: rnraghavan
Reviews.Content: We were 10 friends and wanted to visit the Universal Studios. We decided to stay at LA for 2 nights and do a day trip to the studios. We had originally booked some unknown hotel but last minute those guys ditched us by not confirming our booking. We were lucky enough to figure out that Marriot Downtown LA was offerring a very good price (If I remember right it was $129 per night). We had a train station closeby which we used to get to the studios and we had a few stores nearby where we could pick up stuff back home. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; Spendy parking”
Reviews.Author: UScardinal
Reviews.Content: We bid $60 on Priceline.com and got this very nice hotel in downtown Los Angeles. What we didn't plan on was this hotel was valet parking exclusively, at a rate of $30 a night, so there went my savings. The hotel is beautiful, and situated among the tall buildings of the downtown area. We had a 10th floor downtown view, in a beautiful King Bed room. Very nice bathroom, and comfortable bed. Our problem was we were out of our element staying at this hotel, because it is pricey. The coffee shop cost us $54 for the two of us to eat at the breakfast buffet, and that was not including tip. We are more used to a Denny's breakfast. We went on Priceline to save money, but ended up spending more on parking and breakfast, but that doesn't take away the fact that the Marriott downtown is a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory for the price in downtown L.A. but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bellaalma
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were in L.A. for an extended weekend (Friday-Monday) during the last week of March 2009 because we were going to the 3 Prince concerts at L.A. Live. We were looking for an inexpensive, convenient and CLEAN hotel in downtown L.A. for our stay. The Marriott was inexpensive compared to other downtown L.A. hotels, and it was convenient enough (walking distance) from the places we planned to see in downtown L.A. The positives: The hotel is clean. There were never any dirty towels or bedding. The staff was very nice, professional and helpful. It also felt safe. Our room was clean; it was a nice size and had floor to ceiling windows with a nice view of Figueroa Street and downtown L.A. from the 7th floor. The beds were comfortable as well. The negatives: This place could REALLY use some updating. The TVs are very outdated. They don't even have basic video/audio inputs. The furniture looks like it is from the 1980s. The carpet is outdated as well. It has to be at least 10 - 15 years old. All the light fixtures are outdated as well. Also, the lock on our door had several loose screws that I actually tightened myself with a pair of scissors. One thing that really bothered me was the lack of free Internet access in the business center. The hotel charges $10 for 20 minutes of Internet access. Neither of has had laptops so we ended up spending $30 on Internet access. Another issue was the refrigerator in our room. It did not work, so the hotel placed a note inside it stating that we could “rent” a portable one for a daily fee. Also, the elevators were often slow due to maintenance, and we had to take the service elevators often. The hotel only has one restaurant, which we did not try. However, the Westin is a block away and has more restaurants. There are also other places to eat in walking distance. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay, but I really think that it is on its last legs. A new Marriott is being built in the L.A. Live complex about 7 blocks away, so I can't see them putting much money into updating this one.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott, But in Top 5 Downtown”
Reviews.Author: GSH81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott for approximately 5 months and I will say it is as average as it comes. The staff is great and concierge lounge is nice and large and a bit nicer than average, but the decor is a bit outdated in some rooms, the fitness center is small for this size of the hotel, and elevators don’t seem to handle the morning traffic. However, when looking downtown LA, there's really not too many that are better for the business traveler. As with other hotels downtown, the busyness of this hotel ebbs and flows when there are conventions in town or when the foreign bus tours are in town. When that happens, it seems to slow everything down dramatically. Waiting for an elevator between 8am-9am can be painful even if you are on a high floor as you'll stop at every floor and the elevator will likely be crowded with tourists with huge suitcases. If you're on a low floor, good luck with the stairs or the maintenance elevators. Over the months I was there (May- Oct) the issues with the elevators were always apparent whenever the hotel was near capacity. All in all that's only a minor setback, but can grow to be a major annoyance if you stay here for a while. There really aren't too many options downtown for the average business traveler, but this hotel offers all of the standard amenities you'd expect for in a Marriott. If you stay for a while, the staff becomes even friendlier as they get to know you… once again kind of what you expect from this tier of hotel, but you don’t always find that everywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Public Spaces”
Reviews.Author: boston02118
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Very beautiful and comfortable lobby. Cool and soothing. Mainly a business hotel with a downtown location and thoroughly enjoyed my stay given that my activities were focused in the downtown area. Rooms were larger than typical rooms you find at the large chains. Very well-appointed and clean. Nice pool and patio area. Didn't have extensive interaction with the staff, but overall very polite and accommodating staff. Valet parking with in and out privileges. Easy access the Santa Monica and Harbor freeway, and Interstate 5. Finally, the bar in the lobby was fantastic...relaxing place to have a drink and watch a game or chat. Would stay there again in a minute, for business or pleasure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant 2 Nights Stay”
Reviews.Author: sillypie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Oct 08, was part of UA super value deal. My colleagues and I decided to come earlier for some leisure time before transferring to Hollywood area to attend a business conference. I was given a single room with a double bed (the only lady in the group). The room was clean and spacious and I loved the interior decoration, cozy! But being a Marriott hotel, I would expect better provision of room amenities like fridge, sewing kits, toothpaste/toothbrush etc. Only shampoo, shower foam and lotion were provided..Mmm, wonder was it due to the value package... so certain stuffs were not given.. We tried the buffet breakfast on the last morning, limited variety for US$25. Location wise, nothing much to see with tall business buildings. There was a Macy department store down the street, within walking distances. Got a map from the reception which was useful. The nearest Metro station 7th Street/Metro Center was 15 min away. We took the metro on the second day to visit the Ontario Mills(outlet mall) with some train transfer. Overall, our stay here was pleasant and the hotels staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Two words "Loved it"”
Reviews.Author: erac87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a suite at This Hotel and it was Great!! Everything from the arrival to the departure it was all good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for families visiting LA”
Reviews.Author: CVTravelerSoCal
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Hollywood and Santa Monica over the weekend with two pre-teen kids and used Marriott Rewards to book this hotel. There isn't a whole lot to do with kids in downtown LA but the weekend rooms are usually substantially cheaper than similar properties around the Hollywood area. You can get to the fun places in and around LA with a 15-30 mn drive from here (see my posting on things to do in LA with kids). This is a large, clean hotel with good service. I thought $30 for valet parking was a little excessive. We did not eat in the hotel but there are a couple good breakfast places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: gracek312
Reviews.Content: While I can't give this hotel 5-stars, it secures a very, very strong 4 stars in my book. We have been at this hotel many times - basically each time we visit LA from San Francisco. This last time, we were there for a full week, and I remain thoroughly impressed. For Platinum members, their upgrade policy is very generous. Each time we have been there, we have been upgraded to a great suite. One of the times was a junior suite of sorts - which was an enormous room with a bilevel sleeping/living area with nonstop views out the window. This last time, we spent the week in the Vista Suite on the 5th floor (room 501) and it was an outstanding room with floor to ceiling windows on 3/4 walls, huge living room with dining area, a lot of space, a large bedroom with a really comfortable bed, and terrific room service for morning coffee. They were speedy, too. Also - their front desk service is phenomenal. Though we were originally booked for a certain number of days, when we called to change, it was all taken care of without any problems at all, no matter that they were booking a Vista Suite for the standard room price or anything. They accomodated us in every way. I should note, though, that for such a high-class room, their TVs really need some upgrading. They had 24" tubes... and while this is just a minor details, it's details like this that prevent this hotel from getting 5 stars. Their hotel lobby is large - sprawling, actually, and while the layout is a bit weird (you have to go all the way to one corner to go up to your room), the lobby is always bustling with activity and makes for a good location for people to come and visit you, if you don't intend to head out to eat or drink. There always seems to be something going on, be it a party or convention, upstairs on the 2nd floor. Valet service was fast and efficient, and location is central to wherever you need to go in LA. It's right around the corner from the 110 freeway, and only minutes to K-town, 15 minutes to Beverly Hills (if LA had no traffic, which I should add, never happens), and merely 25 minutes to LAX - by distance, anyhow. I would not hesitate to stay here time and again - and would highly recommend anyone who plans to stay in LA to consider this particular Marriott. Given that I am not a Marriott fan at all (it's my boyfriend who is a loyal member while I am a SPG girl) I have to say that this particular hotel rates up there with Westins.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Papaleadfoot
Reviews.Content: Well located downtown and easy to get to this large hotel is well staffed. Had a Vista Suite provided by the Company for business meetings at the hotel, The Vista suites are giant w/large bedroom; bathroom w/separate shower, and gargantuan living room w/dining table. Clean & comfortable. Meeting rooms were set well. Valet parking. Small and busy lobby bar. OK restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Canada_1987
Reviews.Content: Booked the same day as arrival and only paid 140$ a night for 2 queens. Check-in was easy, lots of staff on hand. If you bring your car you have to valet check your car. You can go in and out as many times as you want per day but you must phone 10 minutes before if you want your car. 16$ a day for parking. The room itself was great. 2 queens and a large bathroom. We had a great view from a room on downtown LA. The beds were nice and comfy. We ate at the hotel restaurant the Back Porch. Service was good as well as the food. The prices were moderate. You can have a nice meal for under 15 dollars. There is also a gift shop where you can buy snacks. There are some nice reastaurants within walking distance. We went to the California Pizza Kitchen which is about a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and sat out on the patio. For breakfast during the week, go to the second floor and exit the hotel and walk over the pedestrian bridge that connects to the World Trade Center. Right after you walk in there is on your left a little restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. We went there for breakfast and it only cost us 4$ and it was great! The swimming pool at the hotel is great. Just missing a hot tub and it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Toton-traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with reward points, for one night as we were taking the Amtrak Coast Starlight to Portland the next day, and wanted to be centrally located. We were allocated rooms on a concierge level which meant we got evening snacks and a breakfast included. The rooms were fantastic, with floor to ceiling windows offering a great view of LA. As we were with our children we went to the outdoor pool, which was only small, but did the job of amusing them for an hour or so. My husband and I had a meal in the restaurant in the evening which was really nice, and there was a really relaxed ambience in the hotel. We really enjoyed our short stay here and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel especially for a business stay”
Reviews.Author: Nabaaty
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband found a great " last minuet deal " for LA including flight + hotel + car so in this case we did not picked this Marriott. However, we liked the hotel. It was clean and nice and if you are in LA for business, God ,this location is amazing it is just right in front of World Trade Center and many other banks and institutes. We did not like the restaurant and bar much it was pricey for what they offer and you have to use Valet Parking $17 pn, which is not too bad for downtown LA. Over all it was good but if I want to go to LA again for vacation I would not stay there, I perhaps book a room in Hollywood district or Santa Monica beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: nhumbc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to CA-110 and had no problems finding it. When we drove in, we were greeted right away and opening our car doors and asked us if we needed help with our luggage or wanted to park our car. Check-in was very quick and the staff was friendly. The room was clean and roomy, especially the bathroom. It had a separate bath and a shower. The bedspread was a little out dated, but clean. There were connecting rooms available, which we were in. There was also a cabinet that looks like it is suppose to be a mini bar, but it was not stock or working. The only thing negative about the hotel was the parking. They only offer valet parking for $16.50. I chose not to use the valet parking and park it myself across the street at the world trade center. The parking was only $9.90 with no in/out privileges if you arrive before 10 AM or after 4:30 PM and you could park for 24 hours until the regular rates kick in. This was fine with us since we only use the garage for over night parking. The hotel even has a walkway that connects the world trade center parking garage. Just take elevator to the 1st floor and follow sign to the Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: GHB2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed many times at the L.A. downtown Marriott. Only because it is so convenient to Dodger stadium. I may re-think it after this past stay. The place needs work to put it in simple terms. The elevators were a bit scary sounding and quite shaky. And not all of them were working. The air condition in the rooms and in the hallways wasn’t good enough to keep anything cool. The sports bar only played half of the TV's while we were there. If I didn’t know any better I would say that they are trying to cut costs by not using so much electricity. The concierge barely spoke English and didn’t really understand it too well either. The beds were not the quality Marriott beds that most have already upgraded to. Like I said in the beginning I have stayed here many times and every time I do it seems to be a little more run down or just not up to where it should be. All that said the hotel is still an okay place. It is not a category 5 hotel as Marriott has labeled it though. Hopefully they will put some money back into the hotel otherwise it will be time to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: azlaw26
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal through Hotwire---$75/night. The rooms were excellent (comfortable beds, clean, spacious), and the amentities were great (indoor gift shop with lots of yummy snacks, drinks, and was open super late). During the holidays, the lobby is cheery and classy. Staff is friendly and helpful---they helped me find a good palce to eat and even made some phone calls on my behalf. It is in the heart of downtown (although, los angeles didn't seem to have much a nightlife in the middle of the city), and there is a movie theatre within close walking distance. The second level of the hotel is connected to a large indoor shopping area with sushi restaurants and other shops. However, these shops are not open very late and seem to accommodate the business people during the week. Lastly, I didn't realize this at the time, but this is the hotel where Christopher Walken filmed that Fat Boy Slim video, which is a a nice bonus! Who doesn't love Walken?

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: life_is_my_vacation
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this downtown Marriott. Our room was a little bit smaller this time than last, and the rooms are nothing special, but the beds are VERY comfortable and the bathrooms are really nice. The beds have wonderful mattresses with fitted mattress pads and bottom sheets (what a difference it makes compared to most hotels, where the mattress pad and bottom sheet slide into a ball ten minutes after you're in bed), plus the sheets and comforter are very soft. The bathroom is nice and big, with a separate tub and shower with large rain showerhead. We only had one problem - my dad found stains on his bottom sheet - but they sent up someone to replace the sheet and offered us free breakfast buffet vouchers ($20 value per voucher). Overall, this is a fine hotel if you need to stay in downtown LA, although not quite as nice as the Westin or Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott OK for downtown”
Reviews.Author: bagjag27
Reviews.Content: Don't stay downtown if you're here on a weekend since it basically shuts down friday night through sunday, and if you don't have a car you're trapped in this urban island of skyscrapers with poor public transportation. If you have to be in this area, however, the Marriott is nice. Comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, good pool. Expensive drinks and food as expected - skip the bar and find the local brewpub 2 blocks away. Parking is $20 per day (and so is the breakfast buffet - skip this too).

Reviews.Title: “It's true, dated and ugly rooms - and tha's the good news!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan8
Reviews.Content: I sure wish I did NOT book a hotel from Priceline (especially using their name-your-own-price option), the few dollars we saved were just not worth it… 9 nights of nightmare, April 1 - 10! (Nope, Priceline won't entertain any complaints or hotel replacement.) 1. The first thing that greeted us when we entered the room was a big cigarette burn hole on the curtain. After informing Priceline and the hotel about that glaring hole, they did not replaced the curtain - not even till the day we left – 9 nights later. And this is a smoke-free hotel! That's just the beginning of more lousy things to come from this 4-star hotel! 2. The mini-bar (fridge) looks as ugly as the cabinet that housed it - and it does not work. I was informed by their staff that ALL the mini-fridges in ALL their rooms do NOT work! (Mind you, this is supposed to be a 4-star, world-famous hotel chain with a rack rate of US$169 and up + tax per night !) 3. Everything in the room looks dated because they are very old. The furniture and doors are full of scratches! And if you are expecting Westin-type of beds, you would be extremely disappointed. To be fair, the beds are fine - if it is a Motel 6. Their pillows must be the smallest pillows available in the hotel industry! 4. The TV is at least 15 years old! I know this for a fact as I bought my first flat-screen Sony Wega TV when it was introduced around the mid-90s - yes, the TV in my room is of a much older generation with curved screen! (But at their lobby, they have 2 new-looking, huge plasma TVs. Talk about misleading ads.) 5. No free wireless Net access. Not even in the lobby. 6. Worst of all? The DO not always tell you when your packages arrive! You'll have to check with them daily. They actually told me that I have NO packages when I had 2. Yes, it happened to me – twice in my short stay! 7. To be fair, the ventilation fan in the bathroom works really well, ditto that for their rain shower. 8. The following won't apply to you if you don't mind drinking tap water or paying US$4 per 500 ml bottle of water and if you don't mind taking a cab to almost everywhere as the closest subway station is about 5 to 6 blocks away. Nearest grocery store: 20 minutes walk or US$7 + tip cab fare away. Coming back will be uphill all the way. (The buses that stop near the hotel and run frequently stop running at 6.30 p.m.) The Westin, just opposite this hotel offers their guest free shuttle to many places. To add insult to injury, there are many other better hotels you can stay for less! And those hotels don't fool you by calling themselves a 4-star establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: KAHS
Reviews.Content: Our room had a king size bed. Very comfortable room... very clean room. The bathroom was really nice. Stayed here on business with my husband. Was in walking distance to good restaurants. We also walked to the subway to go out to Hollywood. We had a great view of the outdoor pool. Pool was shallow.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A_ViLo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family. The service was ok, and the staff seemed good at the beginning but then one day we left our camera in the room, when we return the camera wasn´t there! We called the front desk personal and they told us that they were going to start a "investigation", the only person beside us who entered the room was the housekeeper. They asked her and she said that she didn´t take it. AND THAT WAS ALL THEY DID! they didn´t do anything else and the people from the front desk didn´t even care. The worst experience I´ve ever had. I expected much more considering what we pay. Follow my advise, do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Staff at Marriott and Bad Bed”
Reviews.Author: monarchtravel
Reviews.Content: After paying $240 a night plus $15 a night for parking I expected more from the Marriott. We were very unimpressed with the staff at the Marriott. When arriving, the door men watched us as we struggled to get our luggage out of our trunk and into the hotel until my husband asked for some assisitance. In the bar and grill we told the waitress that we were in a hurry in order to get to a basketball game and she proceeded to ignore us throughout our dinner, and we in fact had to physically track her down to get our check. When we departed we called ahead for car to be brought up which it was, but it was parked way down the driveway and as we once again struggled to take our luggage to our car no help was offered. Besides the unfriendly and unhelpful service throughout our stay the bed was extremely uncomfortable - sloped towards the middle. The bedding was beautiful but that didn't make up for a difficult nights sleep in the old bed. I will not be coming back again to stay when they charge this kind of money for what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: FunMom702
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Marriott for business travel, needed to be close to the convention center. I would not rate this hotel as a 4 star property at all. Maybe a 3 star. We changed rooms after the first jr. suite they gave us on a lower floor was in desperate need of renovation plus the heat did not work. (this room would not even qualify for 2 stars!) We were moved to a higher floor and although the room was better, it still was more like a 3 star hotel. Once again, the heating did not work well. On a positive note, the bed was comfortable and the service was great. They say they are renovating this year, so maybe after the completion, we would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way To See La”
Reviews.Author: Rebelsasha
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Marriott Downtown in September 2007. Great hotel. Location is ideal for business, not so much for leisure. Staff are friendly and car hire desk on site is very handy. Would definitely stay here again as hotel is reasonably priced. Pool is great but small enough and sun is gone by about 5pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad restraunts”
Reviews.Author: jenandcraig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel December 14th thru December 17, 2007. It is a very pretty hotel with comfy beds, clean rooms, nice bathroom. Mine had a seperate tub and shower, phone near the comode, and granite thru-out. Very pretty.....You do have to valet park, like at most places you stay at downtown, and I found that is was on the cheap side for only $16.50 a day! The check-in was very easy and staff is helpful with printed directions for your traveling needs. The Marriott has 2 restraunts and 1 bar. So I decided 1 of the nights that I was going to try one of the 2 and see how good they were. To my surprise, both restraunts had the exact same menu, which I thought was kinda weird, but whatever. So my guest and I both order a salad apiece (mine a garden salad with ranch (which was sour and the lettuce was limp), his a nice chef salad with alot of ham and turkey! Then we ordered 2 different appetizers each, I had the Monty's Special which consisted of half a chicken quesadilla, chicken wings, a tasteless shrimp skewer and lobster ravoli with some stange sauce atop (yuck!). My guest had tempura like, itty-bitty shrimp and fried calamari (dry and again tasteless..). We only had soft drinks and after our boring and lack-luster dinner and $55 later, I'd say walk about 4 blocks down and you'll probably have a much better dining experiance and probably cheaper! Overall, this is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Maximr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a typical Marriott property. The rooms are well appointed and clean, and the service is as usual. I've stayed here several times, and it's convenient, the check in process is fast and checkout can be done over phone or TV. They offer the "concierge level" rooms at a premium rate. Stayed in one also. In addition to the usual room amenities it had a shoe polish machine and an additional clothing rack. Other than that, staying on this level gives you access to the concierge lounge, where they serve Hors d'Oeuvres in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The evening reception doesn't include drinks and is scheduled between 6 and 10 PM. In my opinion, the benefits of the concierge level aren't worth the rate premiums, but some people may find it a nice touch on their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidAndPed
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room and got a penthouse suite. It is very nice. We were tourists however the hotel seemed to be geared up for business use. You need a car to get around but if you want to be on foot I think it is about 10 minutes walk to 7th street. There is a small Macy near there, most of restaurants around this area only open for lunch time. We walked to the Staple Center to see L A Kings Ice hockey, took about 20 minutes walk. Enjoyed our stay there...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CariBelle
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline for this stay since we were attending a wedding in the Downtown area but didn't want to pay the super hight price to stay at the location. I was pleasantly surprised when we received this hotel for a bid of $75.00. The bell hop/valet service was excellent and the front staff very nice. The room was excellent the bathroom was the best part! A tub that was long enough for my 6' 5" boyfriend to stretch out in! It's very rare that we find that in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tootyfancy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline (3-star), although I think it's a 3.5 star. Got a great deal, but didn't know what to expect. We skipped the valet parking and found a metered spot right outside on the street, which ended up costing us $5. The hotel was packed, but the room on the top floor was really quite. Great views of downtown and the 110 freeway, you can definately hear the traffic, but in a babbling brook kind of way. I'm a light sleeper and had no problems. The bed was clean and comfy. Walked to the Disney Hall for a symphony, which was a decent walk. There's a Laemmle theatre downstairs and Ciudad restaurant 1/2 block away. Happy hour from 4-7 weeknights, great mojitos/sangria. Room service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in financial district”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night on a stopover from Costa Rica to Hong Kong. Compared to other hotels I've stayed in in the United States, I was pleasantly surprised about this hotel. It had good, speedy check-in service, a great big room, and for $121 my room rate was cheaper than most hotels near LAX. I ate at the cafe downstairs and had a really good Chinese Chicken Salad. The service was speedy and very efficient. The only downside about this hotel is it's in the financial district so if you need to go shopping in Beverly Hills you'll need a car. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need A Face Lift!”
Reviews.Author: AquaV
Reviews.Content: We will probably not ever stay here again...or at least, not unless we hear that the rooms have been updated and remodeled. The rooms need to have the popcorn removed from the ceiling. All furniture is super old and outdated. Nothing impressive in the rooms at all. There was not even a light over the shower or toilet, very dark! The lobby is nice. It is NOT a good representation of what you will see once you step foot inside your room. This was the grossest Marriott I have ever stayed in. It was difficult to communicate with some of the staff and they were not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay was OK...”
Reviews.Author: PATravel053
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Los Angeles, CA recently with my job... helped in an office out there in Downtown, LA for 2 weeks. Decided to stay at the Marriott Los Angeles Downtown for the whole 2 weeks. My overall stay was ok. The pros and cons: Pros: Big room - great view of parts of the city. Big bathroom - lots of light from the mirror lights. Easy access to highways. Heated outside pool. Close to some restaurants (within walking distance). Cons: Food in hotel restaurant a little expensive ($15.00/club sandwich). Valet parking - makes it hard to just come/go as you please. Highway is next to hotel (can hear traffic during the evening). Charge for water in room ($6.00/bottle... buy your own in vending machines... alot cheaper). They charged me for a bottle of it (which I did not drink, had them credit it to my invoice when checking out). No mini-fridge in room... so can't bring food back to room to keep cool. Pool area was being used quite frequently during my stay for weddings/meetings/etc..., so swimming was limited. Lost electricity in the middle of the night (for about 3 hours) - they never said a word to me about it... I heard my cell phone beep when the power was cut off to it while charging... called the front desk, they said they expected it on by morning and would give me a wake up call. But in the mean time, no backup lights were available (as to being able to use the bathroom). Some restaurants in the walking area I would recommend: The Original Pantry (open 24/7 - blackboard menu - large portions and good food) and The California Pizza Kitchen. I went to the Farmers Market/Grove over by Hollywood... ate at The Cheesecake Factory there... very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: teddylisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from Sept 2-8. Pros: -Good location, quiet and clean. right next to the highway. -Beautiful hotel, high ceiling and great customer service Cons: -expensive: food (but good: breakfast buffet : 20.00), valet parking is $18.00 per day, plus tipping ofcourse.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - In need of new decor”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler1973
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights during a trip to L.A. This is a nice, clean hotel in a great location. Aside from the temperature in the room being hard to maintain, our stay was very enjoyable. The hotel could use an upgrade to its decor and getting your car from valet becomes a hassle if you like to stay on the go. Overall, it was a good stay. I would use this hotel again after testing out one or two other area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for short stay”
Reviews.Author: bdouty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights recently while taking my daughter to USC. Easy to get to from the airport , convenient to USC, and not too hard to get to attractions of Beverly Hills, Hollywood, Santa Monica as long as you have a car. Usual good Marriott service. It could use some updating - the carpet in the lobby is atrocious! Room was clean and the bathroom appeared to have been recently updated, surprisingly comfortable bed (and I sleep badly at most hotels). We had breakfast once in the hotel, very overpriced mediocre food. It was a good value overall for what I paid, but would not recommend it for LA tourists given its downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: rafael100
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, well-designed hotel with helpful staff and good-sized rooms. A pleasant surprise was that the hotel wasn't huge, like the Bonaventure across the way. I actually felt like I was in a boutique hotel. Some people aren't comfortable in downtown LA, which lacks charm to put it mildly. But it's an easy walk to good food and to entertainment (museums and Disney Hall within walking distance, 3 movie theaters on the hotel premises). A fabulous Gold's Gym (complete with pool and boxing ring) is just 3 blocks away. LA's public transportation system is underrated, yet it has received recent rewards, and deservedly so. From the hotel, 25 cents during dayltime hours on LA DOT's shuttle will get you to Little Tokyo and to Chinatown, just a mile or two away, with a neighborhood feel and lots of moderate-priced restaurants.The LA Metro takes you to the center of Hollywood in 20 minutes. I even managed to get to the Getty Villa in Malibu on two city buses, in just over an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, bad location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: TeeJay33
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a fantastic hotel with great amenities. It is clean friendly and very accommodating. The only problem is the location. This hotel is ideal for business travellers, but for tourists there is very little you can do in Downtown LA. The underground and taxis are very convenient, but we would suggest stay North Hollywood if your on holiday otherwise you will spend a great deal of time and money in cabs or on the tube. This is definately the best Marriott we have stayed in in any country. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: matjackson
Reviews.Content: excellent service, rooms big enough and very clean, some noise from freeway, although we preferred this view and spent 8 nights overlooking it, so def no problem. pool ok, but tending to the shadey, so not muchgood after 5pm. weekends cheaper by a long way and included breakfast buffet which was awesome ( if free) but could be beaten for value in a million LA restaurants if not! valet parking excellent service and well worth it here, with the valets very knowledgeable about routes and distances to attractions/malls etc. Not too far from anywhere....theme parks (incl 6flags), hollywood, restaurants as its straight onto Wilshire blvd and also the i5. Go to the Ivy from here, superb night out. watch the traffic on the 5 and 110,101 esp in rush hour and tak an alt route thru the boulevards and save hours!

Reviews.Title: “NICE & CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: FRANK57
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, and staff is polite. Beds are very very comfortable. Lobby is inviting for lounging and having a drink. As of 07 the whole hotel is non smoking. Hotel is centrally located in downtown, and accessible to all major freeways. Although mostly labeled as business hotel, it’s also good for vacationers. The hotel is close to little Tokyo, which has some great cuisine. Try Sushi Ghen & Shabu Shabu. Jump on the freeway, and Dodger stadium, Pasadena, Hollywood, Santa Monica are close. Yes downtown is desolate at night, so do not go walking. However during the daytime it’s ok. For the more curious, walk through the historic core on Broadway Blvd. This is the historic theater row district. Also try Spring Street, the historic financial district. If your stay is strictly business, you will find the hotel meets all you needs. Parking is valet only, $16.5 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MoJo10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from June 1, 2006 to June 3, 2006. The hotel was very easy to get to from LAX airport. Although we were told that the Metro not far from the hotel takes you into Hollywood and all the sites there, we did not take it. We drove from our hotel to Hollywood Blvd to see all the touristy sites. It was only a 10 minute drive and very easy! The hotel and downtown/finacial area was like a ghost town on the weekend. There is a movie theatre right next to the hotel which was very convienient! Also, the hotel recommended many restaurants all within walking distance from the hotel to eat dinner at. (between 2-5 blocks) We ate at the restaurant Engine something or another. It was fantastic! Definitely recommend the meatloaf dinner! Casual setting. The hotel had a nice pool outside, great breakfast buffett ($19.99 per person) and a great bar night life! The room was clean and large! We paid $143 a night on the weekend and thought it was very reasonable in comparison to other hotels in the area. The bathroom was really impressive and nice for a Marriott! We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: maryr1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before beginning a tour. It was an absolute joy. Desk staff were more than helpful with suggesting dining and shopping options, the store in the foyer was well stocked, restraurants looked busy and the hotel felt classy and homey. I had a room on the 9th floor that looked over the freeway, pool and city, and found that was quite pleasant to look at surprisingly. The room had floor to ceiling windows, a very comfortable king bed, fantastic bathroom and fluffly robes. I stayed in watching TV in bed and fell asleep very comfortable and happy. Check out was easy, quick and friendly - would stay there again on return to LA very happily.

Reviews.Title: “LA is just one big freeway...”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: The Harbor Freeway goes right by this hotel - and if you have an odd-numbered room you will hear it, all night. For some unknown reason, the hotel is not soundproofed properly. If you need to stay here, ask for an even-numbered room away from the Freeway. Otherwise, the hotel is clean and the staff seemed efficient. I ate elsewhere, so cannot comment on the food etc. There were some panhandlers in surrounding streets, but also plenty of cops on bikes and in cars. The convention center is a fairly long walk, but straight down the street.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Los Angeles Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 333 S Figueroa St, Los Angeles, CA 90071
